name: py-gemini

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
GEMINI (GEnome MINIng) is a flexible framework for exploring genetic
variation in the context of the wealth of genome annotations available
for the human genome.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: tabix
dependencies.description: Generic indexer for TAB-delimited genome position files

dependencies.name: grabix
dependencies.description:
Grabix leverages the fantastic BGZF library in samtools to provide
random access into text files that have been compressed with bgzip.
grabix creates it's own index (.gbi) of the bgzipped file. Once indexed,
one can extract arbitrary lines from the file with the grab command. Or
choose random lines with the, well, random command.

dependencies.name: bedtools2
dependencies.description:
Collectively, the bedtools utilities are a swiss-army knife of tools for
a wide-range of genomics analysis tasks. The most widely-used tools
enable genome arithmetic: that is, set theory on the genome.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-inheritance
dependencies.description:
This module is a general-purpose framework for evaluating if a family
exihibits, for example, and autosomal dominant pattern.

dependencies.name: py-geneimpacts
dependencies.description:
Given multiple snpEff or VEP or BCFTools consequence annotations for a
single variant, get an orderable python object for each annotation.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-sqlalchemy
dependencies.description: The Python SQL Toolkit and Object Relational Mapper

dependencies.name: py-pysam
dependencies.description: A python module for reading, manipulating and writing genomic data sets.

dependencies.name: py-cyvcf2
dependencies.description: fast vcf parsing with cython + htslib

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-pybedtools
dependencies.description: Python wrapper -- and more -- for Aaron Quinlan's BEDTools

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-bottle
dependencies.description:
Bottle is a fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for
Python.

dependencies.name: py-ipyparallel
dependencies.description: IPython's architecture for parallel and distributed computing.

dependencies.name: py-ipython-cluster-helper
dependencies.description:
Quickly and easily parallelize Python functions using IPython on a
cluster, supporting multiple schedulers. Optimizes IPython defaults to
handle larger clusters and simultaneous processes.

dependencies.name: py-bx-python
dependencies.description:
The bx-python project is a python library and associated set of scripts
to allow for rapid implementation of genome scale analyses.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-openpyxl
dependencies.description: A Python library to read/write Excel 2010 xlsx/xlsm files

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-unidecode
dependencies.description: ASCII transliterations of Unicode text

dependencies.name: py-cyordereddict
dependencies.description:
The Python standard library's OrderedDict ported to Cython. A drop-in
replacement that is 2-6x faster.

dependencies.name: py-bcolz
dependencies.description:
bcolz provides columnar and compressed data containers. Column storage
allows for efficiently querying tables with a large number of columns.
It also allows for cheap addition and removal of column. In addition,
bcolz objects are compressed by default for reducing memory/disk I/O
needs. The compression process is carried out internally by Blosc, a
high-performance compressor that is optimized for binary data.

dependencies.name: py-numexpr
dependencies.description: Fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy
